Title: The Five Questions Companies Ask About Social Media

Author: Hexayurt
Content:
Python. PHP is really good for hacking things out, and there's a case to be made for using Python for the back end programming, and odds-and-sods of PHP to extract data into templates and so on - but fundamentally if you have real code to write, use Python.

PHP ain't bad, but PHP code is fragile. The language, over a year or two, meanders about breaking code willy-nilly, and that alone is good enough reason to steer clear of it for serious applications.

Author: thomasfl
Content: I prefer jQuery. It's the fastest growing javascript library. It's the newest javascript library on the list. It runs fast, and most importantly; it has a very simple and readable syntax.

Author: vineet21
Title: Deadly Domains
Content: "Companies that assign addresses for web sites might be giving security measures a miss when they assign names in certain domains than in others."
